com.innowhere.jnieasy.core.typedec
Interface NativeTypeManager

public interface NativeTypeManager

The NativeTypeManager is the interface used to declare native types using native capable classes (user defined or predefined).

Author:
Jose M. Arranz Santamaria
See Also:
JNIEasy.getTypeManager()

Returns the utility object to declare native variable types.

Returns:
the NativeVarTypeManager object.

getClass

java.lang.Class getClass(java.lang.String className)
Loads and returns the specified class with the ClassLoader defined in the framework.

The className parameter can have Java language syntax, if is useful with array class names like int[] (Class.forName() methods does not work with this format).

Parameters:
className - the class name to load.
Returns:
the loaded class.
See Also:
getClassLoader()

getClassLoader

java.lang.ClassLoader getClassLoader()
Returns the default ClassLoader currently defined in the framework, to load user native capable and "can be native" capable wrapper classes. It may be an enhancer ClassLoader.

The default ClassLoader is the framework loader. Current implementation returns the ClassLoader of the NativeTypeManager instance).

Returns:
the current framework class loader.
See Also:
setClassLoader(ClassLoader), NativeEnhancer.enableOnLoad(String[],String[],ClassLoader)

setClassLoader

void setClassLoader(java.lang.ClassLoader loader)
Defines the default ClassLoader used by the framework to load user defined native capable and "can be native" wrapper classes

Parameters:
loader - the new default class loader of the framework.
See Also:
getClassLoader()

getDefaultBooleanSize

long getDefaultBooleanSize()
Returns the default memory size of the boolean data type. If not modified by setDefaultBooleanSize(long) the default value is the Java standard size: 1 byte.

This value is used to calculate the native memory size of native instances.

Returns:
the default memory size of the boolean data type.
See Also:
setDefaultBooleanSize(long)

setDefaultBooleanSize

void setDefaultBooleanSize(long size)
Sets the default memory size of the boolean data type.

This value is used to calculate the native memory size of native instances. The alignment is set to this value too. Current implementation is:

setDefaultBooleanSize(size,size);

Parameters:
size - the new memory size.
See Also:
getDefaultBooleanSize(), setDefaultBooleanSize(long,long)

getDefaultBooleanAlignSize

long getDefaultBooleanAlignSize()
Returns the default memory alignment size of the boolean data type. If not modified by setDefaultBooleanSize(long,long) the default value is the same as the Java standard memory size.

This value is used to calculate the native memory layout and alignment of native instances.

Returns:
the default alignment size of the boolean data type.
See Also:
setDefaultBooleanSize(long,long)

setDefaultBooleanSize

void setDefaultBooleanSize(long size,
                           long align)
Sets the default memory and alignment size of the boolean data type.

Valid values: 0, 1, 4 and 8.

1 byte is the size of the "bool" C++ data type, 4 and 8 values can be used to represent the C BOOL macro usually defined as an integer data type, in this case there is no problem of "overflow" converting to the Java boolean, because only the first byte is used (integer literals 0 and 1).

These values are used to calculate the native memory size and alignment of native instances.

Parameters:
size - the new memory size.
align - the new alignment size.
See Also:
getDefaultBooleanSize(), getDefaultBooleanAlignSize()

getDefaultByteAlignSize

long getDefaultByteAlignSize()
Returns the default memory alignment size of the byte data type. If not modified by setDefaultByteSize(long,long) the default value is the same as the Java standard memory size.

This value is used to calculate the native memory layout and alignment of native instances.

Returns:
the default alignment size of the byte data type.
See Also:
setDefaultByteSize(long,long)

setDefaultByteSize

void setDefaultByteSize(long size,
                        long align)
Sets the default memory and alignment size of the byte data type.

Valid values: 0 and 1

These values are used to calculate the native memory size and alignment of native instances.

Parameters:
size - the new memory size.
align - the new alignment size.
See Also:
getDefaultByteSize(), getDefaultByteAlignSize()

getDefaultCharAlignSize

long getDefaultCharAlignSize()
Returns the default memory alignment size of the char data type. If not modified by setDefaultCharSize(long,long) the default value is the same as the Java standard memory size.

This value is used to calculate the native memory layout and alignment of native instances.

Returns:
the default alignment size of the char data type.
See Also:
setDefaultCharSize(long,long)

setDefaultCharSize

void setDefaultCharSize(long size,
                        long align)
Sets the default memory and alignment size of the char data type.

Valid values: 0, 1, 2 and 4.

1 byte is the size of the C char type, 2 bytes is the wchar_t size in Win32, and 4 bytes is the typical wchar_t size in Linux/Mac/Solaris (the upper 2 bytes are lost when converting to the Java char, but this is not a problem because most of the characters of the world can be contained in a 2 byte char).

These values are used to calculate the native memory size and alignment of native instances.

Parameters:
size - the new memory size.
align - the new alignment size.
See Also:
getDefaultCharSize(), getDefaultCharAlignSize()

See Also:
setDefaultLongSize(long,long)

setDefaultLongSize

void setDefaultLongSize(long size,
                        long align)
Sets the default memory and alignment size of the long data type.

Valid values: 0, 4 and 8.

The long data type is very useful to represent cross platform addresses because the 4 (32 bit) and 8 (64 bit) bytes are the typical platform values.

These values are used to calculate the native memory size and alignment of native instances.

Parameters:
size - the new memory size.
align - the new alignment size.
See Also:
getDefaultLongSize(), getDefaultLongAlignSize()

void setDefaultDoubleSize(long size,
                          long align)
Sets the default memory and alignment size of the double data type.

Valid size values: 0 and 8.

Valid size values: 0, 4 and 8.

These values are used to calculate the native memory size and alignment of native instances.

Parameters:
size - the new memory size.
align - the new alignment size.
See Also:
getDefaultDoubleSize(), getDefaultDoubleAlignSize()

getWCharTSize

long getWCharTSize()
Returns the default memory size of the chars used in Unicode strings (the native side of String, StringBuffer, and native wrappers declared as Unicode). The symmetric C type is the wchar_t.

If not modified by setWCharTSize(long) the returned value is the typical wchar_t size of the runtime platform: in Windows is 2 bytes and in Linux/Mac/Solaris is 4 bytes.

Returns:
the default memory size of the chars used in Unicode.
See Also:
setWCharTSize(long)

setWCharTSize

void setWCharTSize(long size)
Sets the default memory size of the chars used in Unicode strings (the native side of String, StringBuffer, and native wrappers declared as Unicode). The symmetric C type is the wchar_t.

Valid values are: 0, 2 and 4 bytes.

2 bytes is the typical size of wchar_t in Windows, and 4 bytes in Linux/Mac/Solaris.

Parameters:
size - the new memory size.
See Also:
getWCharTSize()

getDefaultStringEncoding

int getDefaultStringEncoding()
Returns the default string encoding (ANSI or UNICODE) when declaring native strings and no encoding is specified.

By default is ANSI.

Returns:
the default string encoding.
See Also:
StringEncoding.ANSI, StringEncoding.UNICODE, setDefaultStringEncoding(int)

setDefaultStringEncoding

void setDefaultStringEncoding(int encoding)
Sets the default string encoding (ANSI or UNICODE) when declaring native strings and no encoding is specified.

Parameters:
encoding - the new default string encoding.
See Also:
StringEncoding.ANSI, StringEncoding.UNICODE, getDefaultStringEncoding()

getStructureAlignSize

long getStructureAlignSize()
Returns the current default alignment size applied to field structure based objects.

Native memory of fields of structures, unions, and C++ classes are arranged on native memory using the minimum value of the intrinsic (preferred) alignment size of the field type, the specific value specified, if any, on enhancement, and this default value.

Returns:
the current default alignment size
See Also:
setStructureAlignSize(long), TypeNative.preferredAlignSize(), alignSizeOf(Class)

setStructureAlignSize

void setStructureAlignSize(long size)
Sets the current default alignment size applied to field structure based objects.

Parameters:
size - the new current default alignment size.
See Also:
getStructureAlignSize()

getDefaultImports

java.lang.String[] getDefaultImports()
Returns the default import declarations used to resolve class names.

By default return null, only "java.lang.*" import is used.

Returns:
an String array with the import declarations. Can be null.
See Also:
setDefaultImports(String[])

setDefaultImports

void setDefaultImports(java.lang.String[] importList)
Sets the default import declarations used to resolve class names without package.

The importList parameter must be a string array, each string contains an expression following the format of the parameter of import keyword of Java language. E.g. "java.lang.reflect.*" or "java.lang.reflect.Method".

An extension is permitted: the matching expression may be ended with two asterisks (.**) meaning a recursive tree search, all classes of package and classes of sub packages are matched. The import expression "java.lang.*" is ever added by default to mimic the Java language behavior (resolving String, as java.lang.String etc). If null all classes, except "java.lang.*" classes, must be absolute.

Parameters:
importList - the included list of classes using Java import syntax. Can be null.
See Also:
getDefaultImports()

getMacro

java.lang.Object getMacro(java.lang.String name)
Returns the value, if set, of the specified macro. A null value is returned is the macro is not defined, the value of a defined macro can be null too, use isDefinedMacro(String) to distinguish these two cases.

Parameters:
name - the macro to look for.
Returns:
the value associated to the macro or null.
See Also:
defineMacro(String,Object)

isDefinedMacro

boolean isDefinedMacro(java.lang.String name)
Returns true, if the specified macro was defined.

Parameters:
name - the macro to look for.
Returns:
true if the specified macro was defined.
See Also:
defineMacro(String,Object)

defineMacro

java.lang.Object defineMacro(java.lang.String name)
Defines (registers) the specified macro.

Current implementation is:

return defineMacro(name,null);

Parameters:
name - the macro to look for.
Returns:
the previous value associated to this macro or null if was not defined.
See Also:
defineMacro(String,Object)

defineMacro

java.lang.Object defineMacro(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.Object value)
Defines (registers) the specified macro and associated value.

The macro can be used to resolve native names or sizes.

Parameters:
name - the macro to look for.
value - the associated value.
Returns:
the previous value associated to this macro or null if was not defined.
See Also:
getMacro(String), parseTextWithMacros(String), parseNameWithMacros(String)

undefMacro

java.lang.Object undefMacro(java.lang.String name)
Removes (unregisters) the specified macro and associated value.

Parameters:
name - the macro to look for.
Returns:
the current value associated to this macro or null if was not defined.
See Also:
defineMacro(String,Object)

getMacros

java.util.Map getMacros()
Returns a Map with the registered macro-value pairs.

The returned Map is unmodifiable.

Returns:
a Map with the registered macro-value pairs.
See Also:
defineMacro(String,Object)

parseTextWithMacros

java.lang.String parseTextWithMacros(java.lang.String textExpr)
Parses the specified expression prefixed with macros, and return the text selected.

This utility is very useful when the text resolved is platform/compiler dependent.

The format supported is:

MacroTextPairDec[;MacroTextPairDec[;MacroTextPairDec ...]]
The MacroTextPairDec is defined as:
[Macro:]Text
Where Macro is an optional "selector macro" name, if the macro was defined using defineMacro(String) or defineMacro(String,Object) then the Text is returned, else the following MacroTextPairDec is checked. If the optional Macro prefix is absent the Text is returned

The Text string must not contain ":" and ";" characters.

Example: WIN32:MSVCRT;Linux:/lib/libc.so.6;MacOSX:/usr/lib/libc.dylib;SunOS:/lib/libc.so.1;OtherLibc

The name "MSVCRT" is returned if "WIN32" macro was defined, else "/lib/libc.so.6" if "Linux" macro was defined, else "/usr/lib/libc.dylib" if "MacOSX" macro was defined, else "/lib/libc.so.1" if "SunOS" macro was defined, else "OtherLibc" is returned.

Parameters:
textExpr - the expression to parse.
Returns:
the resolved text.

parseNameWithMacros

java.lang.String parseNameWithMacros(java.lang.String nameExpr)
Parses the specified expression prefixed with macros, and return the selected name.

Current implementation calls parseTextWithMacros(String) and trims the leading and trailing spaces.

This utility is very useful when the name used is platform/compiler dependent.

Example: WIN32: MSVCRT ;Linux: /lib/libc.so.6 ;MacOSX: /usr/lib/libc.dylib ;SunOS: /lib/libc.so.1 ; OtherLibc

The name "MSVCRT" is returned if "WIN32" macro was defined, else "/lib/libc.so.6" if "Linux" macro was defined, else "/usr/lib/libc.dylib" if "MacOSX" macro was defined, else "/lib/libc.so.1" if "SunOS" macro was defined, else "OtherLibc" is returned.

Parameters:
nameExpr - the native name expression to parse.
Returns:
the resolved name.

parseMemorySizeWithMacros

long parseMemorySizeWithMacros(java.lang.String sizeExpr)
Returns the size number (an integer) declared in the specified string expression parsed and resolved with the following format:

SizeDec[;SizeDec[;SizeDec ...]]
SizeDec format is:
[Macro:]SizeExpr
Where Macro is an optional "selector macro" name, if the macro was defined using defineMacro(String) or defineMacro(String,Object) then the SizeExpr is resolved and returned, else the following SizeDec is checked. If the optional Macro prefix is absent the SizeExpr is resolved and used and no more following SizeExpr are scanned.

The SizeExpr has the format:

Macro|LiteralSize
If specified a macro then the macro value (must be defined and an integer) is used, else the literal value is returned.

Examples:

  • "8"
    The size returned is 8
  • "MSC:4;gcc:8;REGISTER_SIZE"
    The size returned is 4 if the "MSC" macro was defined, else is 8 if the "gcc" macro was defined, else the value of the "REGISTER_SIZE" macro is used (must be defined with an integer value or an exception is thrown).

Parameters:
sizeExpr - the expression to parse.
Returns:
the size after parsing and resolving the expression.
See Also:
defineMacro(String,Object), decPrimitive(Class,String,String), TypeNativePrimitive

getDefaultType

TypeNative getDefaultType(java.lang.Object value)
Returns the default native type of the specified value.

The value may be a native capable object or a "can be native object". If is not possible get a complete native type an exception is thrown.

For instance:

NativeTypeManager typeDecMgr = JNIEasy.get().getTypeManager(); TypeNativeString typeDec = (TypeNativeString)typeDecMgr.getDefaultType("Hello");

Parameters:
value - the object to get its default native type.
Returns:
the default native type.

dec

TypeNative dec(java.lang.String decExpr,
               java.lang.String[] importList)
Declares the native type defined in the specified expression string.

An expression string defines how a class that can be native is made native, specifying the missing native info using a special C-Java mixed syntax.

Every class type which can be native has a specific syntax in expressions, see TypeNativePrimitive, TypeNativeArray, TypeNativeStringBased, TypeNativeBehavior and TypeNativePointer for specific syntax.

Spaces are used as separators when necessary and are ignored (and internally trimmed).

The default ClassLoader as returned by getClassLoader() is used to load the referred classes.

The importList parameter is a string array of import declarations as explained in setDefaultImports(String[]) used to resolve class names, if null the default imports are used.

Expression examples:

"int"

Declares the int primitive type as native.
"mypkg.MyStructure[3]"

Declares an array of 3 elements of user defined mypkg.MyStructure elements "by value".

Parameters:
decExpr - the expression string defining the native type.
importList - the included list of classes using Java import syntax. Can be null.
Returns:
the native type object of the declaration.
See Also:
NativeVarTypeManager.dec(String,String[]), getDefaultImports(), dec(Class), TypeNative.getDeclarationString()

dec

TypeNative dec(java.lang.String decExpr)
Declares the native type defined in the specified expression string.

Current implementation is:

return dec(decExpr,null);

Parameters:
decExpr - the expression string defining the native type.
Returns:
the native type object of the declaration.
See Also:
dec(String,String[])

dec

TypeNative dec(java.lang.Class clasz)
Declares the default native type of the specified class.

The clasz parameter must be a user defined native capable a native wrapper or a "can be native" class, otherwise an exception is thrown.

If the Class is not enough to get a native type declaration throws an exception.

Parameters:
clasz - the class to declare.
Returns:
the native type object of the class.
See Also:
NativeVarTypeManager.dec(String,String[])

decPrimitive

TypeNativePrimitive decPrimitive(java.lang.Class clasz,
                                 long size)
Declares the primitive native type specified in the Class parameter with the specified memory size.

The alignment is set to the specified memory size.

Current implementation is:

return decPrimitive(clasz,size,size);

Parameters:
clasz - the primitive class (boolean, int etc).
size - the native memory size.
Returns:
the primitive native type.

decPrimitive

TypeNativePrimitive decPrimitive(java.lang.Class clasz,
                                 long size,
                                 long alignment)
Declares the primitive native type specified in the Class parameter with the specified memory size and alignment.

The specified size and alignment must be valid values according to the native primitive type, see the setDefaultXSize(long,long) methods, where X is Boolean, Char, Int, etc.

Parameters:
clasz - the primitive class (boolean, int etc).
size - the native memory size.
alignment - the native memory alignment.
Returns:
the primitive native type.
See Also:
decPrimitive(Class,String,String)

decPrimitive

TypeNativePrimitive decPrimitive(java.lang.Class clasz,
                                 java.lang.String sizeExpr)
Declares the primitive native type specified in the Class parameter with the specified memory size expression.

The memory size string expression is resolved using parseMemorySizeWithMacros(String). The alignment is set to the specified memory size.

Current implementation is:

return decPrimitive(clasz,sizeExpr,sizeExpr);

Parameters:
clasz - the primitive class (boolean, int etc).
sizeExpr - the native memory size expression.
Returns:
the primitive native type.
See Also:
decPrimitive(Class,String,String), decPrimitive(Class,long)

decPrimitive

TypeNativePrimitive decPrimitive(java.lang.Class clasz,
                                 java.lang.String sizeExpr,
                                 java.lang.String alignSizeExpr)
Declares the primitive native type specified in the Class parameter with the specified memory size and alignment expressions.

The memory size and alignment string expressions are resolved using parseMemorySizeWithMacros(String).

The specified size and alignment must be valid values according to the native primitive type, see the setDefaultXSize(long,long) methods, where X is Boolean, Char, Int, etc, like setDefaultBooleanSize(long,long).

Parameters:
clasz - the primitive class (boolean, int etc).
sizeExpr - the native memory size.
alignSizeExpr - the native memory alignment.
Returns:
the primitive native type.
See Also:
decPrimitive(Class,long,long)

decAddress

TypeNativeLong decAddress()
Declares a long native type like a platform dependent address.

In a 32 bit platform the native size will be 4 bytes, on 64 bit will be 8 bytes.

This declaration may be used to cross-platform Java native programming.

Returns:
the native type object of the class.
See Also:
TypeNativeLong.isAddress(), NativeManager.getPlatformAddressSize()

decString

TypeNativeString decString(java.lang.Class clasz,
                           int encoding)
Declares a string native type with the specified encoding/size using the java.lang.String class or a native wrapper.

The clasz parameter can be java.lang.String or NativeString or NativeStringAnsi or NativeStringUnicode.

The encoding parameter is useful with String and NativeString, use dec(Class) with NativeStringAnsi and NativeStringUnicode, because encoding is implicitly defined.

Parameters:
clasz - the java.lang.String class or a wrapper.
encoding - the character encoding/size.
Returns:
the native type object of the declaration.
See Also:
StringEncoding.ANSI, StringEncoding.UNICODE, decStringBuffer(Class,int)

                           java.lang.String encodingExpr)

encodingExpr - the encoding value (a macro based expression).
Returns:
the native type object of the declaration.

decArray

TypeNativeArray decArray(java.lang.Class clasz,
                         int[] dims,
                         VarTypeNative compVarType)
Declares a native array type using the specified array class, dimensions and array component native info.

The parameter clasz can be a Java array class like int[] (multidimensional included) or a native array wrapper class like NativeStringArray or a user defined native array.

The number of array dimensions (length of the dims parameter), must be coincident with the number of dimensions defined in the clasz parameter, otherwise an exception is thrown. A dimension value of -1 is equivalent to undefined length. If dims parameter is null, the length of all dimensions is undefined.

The parameter compVarType specifies the native information of the array elements. This native type info must be compatible with the default native type of the element type defined in clasz, this default native type is overwritten with compVarType. If this parameter is null, default native info is used.

Parameters:
clasz - the Java array or native wrapper or a user defined array class.
dims - the lengths of the array dimensions. Can be null.
compVarType - the native info of the array component. Can be null.
Returns:
the native array type of the declaration.
See Also:
NativeVarTypeManager

decArray

TypeNativeArray decArray(java.lang.Class clasz)
Declares a native array type using the specified array class, with dimensions and array component native info by default.

Current implementation is:

return decArray(clasz,null,null);

Parameters:
clasz - the Java array or native wrapper or a user defined array class.
Returns:
the native array type of the declaration.
See Also:
decArray(Class,int[],VarTypeNative)

                         int[] dims)

                         int length)
Declares a one-dimensional native array type using the specified array class and length with default array component native info.

It is a shorthand of the method decArray(Class,int[]) to one-dimensional arrays. Current implementation is:

return decArray(clasz,new int[]{length});

                         int[] dims,
                         int compVarConv)

The compVarConv overwrites the default conventionalism.

decArray

TypeNativeArray decArray(int[] dims,
                         VarTypeNative compVarType)
Declares a native array type using the specified native declaration of the array elements and dimensions.

The parameter compVarType can be any native variable type. Can not be null.

The dimensions parameter array dims defines the number of dimensions and lengths of the declared array. Can not be null. A dimension value of -1 is equivalent to undefined length.

Parameters:
dims - the lengths of the array dimensions.
compVarType - the native info of the array elements.
Returns:
the native array type of the declaration.
See Also:
decArray(Class,int[],VarTypeNative), VarTypeNative.decArray(int[])

                         VarTypeNative compVarType)

return decArray(new int[]{length},compVarType);

                         java.lang.Class compClass)

decStringArray

TypeNativeArray decStringArray(java.lang.Class clasz,
                               int[] dims,
                               int encoding)
Declares a native array type of strings with the specified encoding/size using a java.lang.String array class or a native wrapper or a user defined multidimensional array of String.

The clasz parameter can be a Java array of java.lang.String (multidimensional included as String[][]) or NativeStringArray or NativeStringAnsiArray or NativeStringUnicodeArray or a user defined multidimensional array class of String.

The dims follows the same rules as explained in decArray(Class,int[],VarTypeNative)

The encoding parameter is useful with classes with no implicit encoding like String or NativeStringArray. Use decArray(Class,int[]) with NativeStringAnsiArray and NativeStringUnicodeArray, because encoding is implicitly defined.

Parameters:
clasz - a java.lang.String based array class.
dims - the lengths of the array dimensions. Can be null.
encoding - the character encoding/size.
Returns:
the native type object of the declaration.
See Also:
decString(Class,int)

decStringBufferArray

TypeNativeArray decStringBufferArray(java.lang.Class clasz,
                                     int[] dims,
                                     int encoding)
Declares a native array type of strings with the specified encoding/size using a java.lang.StringBuffer array class or a native wrapper or a user defined multidimensional array of StringBuffer.

The clasz parameter can be a Java array of java.lang.StringBuffer (multidimensional included as StringBuffer[][]) or NativeStringBufferArray or NativeStringBufferAnsiArray or NativeStringBufferUnicodeArray or a user defined multidimensional array class of StringBuffer.

The dims parameter follows the same rules as explained in decArray(Class,int[],VarTypeNative)

The encoding parameter is useful with classes with no implicit encoding like StringBuffer or NativeStringBufferArray. Use decArray(Class,int[]) with NativeStringBufferAnsiArray and NativeStringBufferUnicodeArray, because encoding is implicitly defined.

Parameters:
clasz - a java.lang.StringBuffer based array class.
dims - the lengths of the array dimensions. Can be null.
encoding - the character encoding/size.
Returns:
the native type object of the declaration.
See Also:
decStringBuffer(Class,int)

decStringBufferArray

TypeNativeArray decStringBufferArray(java.lang.Class clasz,
                                     int encoding)
Declares a native array type of strings with the specified encoding/size using a java.lang.StringBuffer array class or a native wrapper or a user defined multidimensional array of StringBuffer.

Current implementation is:

return decStringBufferArray(clasz,null,encoding);

Parameters:
clasz - a java.lang.StringBuffer based array class.
encoding - the character encoding/size.
Returns:
the native type object of the declaration.
See Also:
decStringBufferArray(Class,int[],int)

decStringBufferArray

return decStringBufferArray(StringBuffer[].class,encoding);

Parameters:
encoding - the character encoding/size.
Returns:
the native type object of the declaration.
See Also:

the native type of the declaration.

decBehavior

TypeNativeBehavior decBehavior(java.lang.Class methodClass,
                               NativeBehaviorSignature signature)
Declares a native behavior type using the specified native behavior class and signature.

The parameter methodClass can be any of the following classes/interfaces:

  • Callbacks based on reflection classes
    • java.lang.reflect.Constructor
    • java.lang.reflect.Method
    • java.lang.reflect.Field
  • Callbacks based on native wrappers of reflection classes
    • NativeConstructorReflection
    • NativeMethodReflection
    • NativeStaticMethodReflection
    • NativeInstanceMethodReflection
    • NativeFieldMethodReflection
    • NativeStaticFieldMethodReflection
    • NativeInstanceFieldMethodReflection
  • Native wrappers of DLL methods
    • CPPConstructor
    • CMethod
    • CPPMethod
    • CFieldMethod
  • Native direct callback interfaces (user defined classes are valid too)
    • NativeDirectConstructorCallback
    • NativeDirectStaticMethodCallback
    • NativeDirectInstanceMethodCallback
    • NativeDirectStaticFieldCallback
    • NativeDirectInstanceFieldCallback
  • Generic interfaces of method wrappers
    • NativeConstructor
    • NativeStaticMethod
    • NativeInstanceMethod
    • NativeStaticFieldMethod
    • NativeInstanceFieldMethod
  • Generic callback interfaces of callback based method wrappers
    • NativeConstructorCallback
    • NativeStaticMethodCallback
    • NativeInstanceMethodCallback
    • NativeStaticFieldCallback
    • NativeInstanceFieldCallback

The native signature object type specified with signature must match with the specified method class, otherwise an exception is thrown. For instance, a NativeConstructorSignature object is expected if methodClass is: Constructor, NativeConstructorReflection, CPPConstructor, NativeDirectConstructorCallback, a user defined NativeDirectConstructorCallback class, NativeConstructor and NativeConstructorCallback.

If a user defined class implementing NativeDirectCallback is used, the specified signature is used instead the default signature declared with the class. This class can be used with dec(Class), in this case the default declared signature is used.

Parameters:
methodClass - the behavior class or interface to use.
signature - the native signature of the behavior.
Returns:
the native type of the declaration.
See Also:
NativeBehaviorSignature.decBehavior(Class methodClass)

decConstructor

TypeNativeConstructor decConstructor(java.lang.Class methodClass,
                                     NativeConstructorSignature signature)
Declares a constructor native type using the specified native constructor class and signature.

The parameter methodClass can be any of the following classes/interfaces:

  • Callbacks based on reflection classes
    • java.lang.reflect.Constructor
  • Callbacks based on native wrappers of reflection classes
    • NativeConstructorReflection
  • Native wrappers of DLL methods
    • CPPConstructor
  • Native direct callback interfaces (user defined classes are valid too)
    • NativeDirectConstructorCallback
  • Generic interfaces of method wrappers
    • NativeConstructor
  • Generic callback interfaces of callback based method wrappers
    • NativeConstructorCallback

Current implementation is:

return (TypeNativeConstructor)decBehavior(methodClass,signature);

Parameters:
methodClass - the native constructor class or interface to use.
signature - the native signature of the behavior.
Returns:
the native type of the declaration.
See Also:
decBehavior(Class,NativeBehaviorSignature), NativeConstructorSignature.decConstructor(Class methodClass)

decPointer

TypeNativePointer decPointer(java.lang.Class clasz,
                             VarTypeNative pointerDec)
Declares a native pointer type wrapping the specified declaration of the pointer member.

The pointerDec must be declared "by pointer".

If specified class is user defined, the pointer declaration overwrites the default declaration.

Parameters:
clasz - container class.
pointerDec - the native pointer type to wrap.
Returns:
the native type of the declaration.
See Also:
VarTypeNative.decPointer(), NativePointer

decPointer

TypeNativePointer decPointer(VarTypeNative pointerDec)
Declares a native pointer type wrapping the specified declaration of the pointer member.

Current implementation is:

return (TypeNativePointer)decPointer(NativePointer.class,pointerDec);

Parameters:
pointerDec - the native pointer type to wrap.
Returns:
the native type of the declaration.
See Also:
VarTypeNative.decPointer(), NativePointer
